jobs.description:
The Digital Performance Analyst will work with one or more of DWP’s digital services and help to deliver a service that meets the Government’s Digital by Default Service Standard.

The purpose of this role is to use data and analytical insight from web analytics and wider sources to design and improve digital services that make a real difference to people’s lives. They will identify opportunities to maximise the use of data within the design and running of DWP’s digital services.

The Digital Performance Analyst is an integral part of the agile team developing a digital service; they work with different digital disciplines including User Researchers, Content Designers and Developers on a range of complex and challenging problems.
jobs.responsibilities:
The Digital Performance Analyst is responsible for the analytics at all stages of the agile development lifecycle. They will:

  • Work with services to define measurement frameworks/KPIs that effectively measure the benefits to the Department and citizens and generate new and useful insight.
    Implement and configure the analytical tools (primarily Google Analytics for web analytics) used in the collection, analysis and presentation of data.
    Lead the analysis of key performance data and analysis for the digital service(s) they are working on, including regular reporting and ad-hoc analysis.
    ranslate insight in to actions that will continually improve the user experience and increase the benefit for the Department.
jobs.skills:
Qualification in an analytical discipline. Including knowledge of important analytical concepts such as sampling, statistical significance and bias.
  • Proven experience of working with Google Analytics including:
    Implementation that goes beyond the basic snippet, such as custom tags or virtual pageviews.
    Taking analysis beyond standard reports through building segments, using custom dimensions and using tools such as the GA plugin for Google Sheets or Excel.
    Experience of making data driven recommendations to improve digital services.
    Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills and the ability to quickly develop recommendations based on the quantitative and qualitative evidence gathered via web analytics and other digital sources.
    Proven track record of ability to translate technical concepts to a non-technical audience, including senior management.
    Demonstrable experience with data analysis, web analytics and visualisation tools e.g. Excel, Google Sheets, R etc.
    Proven track record of maximising the value of data, from gathering data and performing analysis through to dissemination and presentation of results.
    Ability to lead and champion working effectively across Departmental and other boundaries.
    Strong interest in and passion for developing and delivering digital services.
jobs.title: Digital Performance Analyst

jobs.description:
DWP is introducing the biggest change to the welfare system in a generation.

The User Experience Design team is designing the digital services to deliver these changes. We work in Digital DWP hubs in Leeds, London, and Newcastle with our own Digital Academy to help us deliver exemplary digital services.

We believe that good design means starting with user needs. Good design is something that works well for the people that need to use it. The User Experience team is also linked to the wider design teams within the Government Digital Service and across government departments.

We are looking for Content Designers who will make an impact in the exciting new arena of developing digital services for the UK Government. Better digital services in government will change the face of public services and have the potential to dramatically transform the future of millions of people.

This is a challenging role that will appeal to professionals looking to join a growing digital team. It is a permanent position with opportunities to grow and develop your role in the organisation.
jobs.responsibilities:
Work on new and existing content for the department’s digital services on GOV.UK.
Improve content and services to ensure accurate, timely, high-quality products.
Develop and apply content strategies.
Act as the authority on matters that have no predictable outcome.
jobs.skills:
Content writing and design skills, including writing for the web
Exemplar grammatical and non-verbal skills
Passion about user needs
Proven record using metrics and feedback to define/refine content
Experience working in technical teams in complex environments
Experience working within a web application development environment
Ability to choose the best format/style for displaying info.
jobs.title: Content Designer
